metadata.topic: If you can't afford to have kids, don't have them.

moderator_initial_opinion:
I am Neutral or Undecided.

This statement can be seen as both a practical consideration and a moral issue. On one hand, having children can be a significant financial burden, and not being able to afford it may be a responsible decision for individuals or couples. On the other hand, the statement can be perceived as judgmental and dismissive of people who may not be able to afford children but still want to have them, or those who are unable to have children due to circumstances beyond their control.
